title: Quiz 3: Org. Communication - Reports & Letters
description: Test your ability to structure official letters and write effective hospital reports.

questions.question: Match the salutation to the correct complementary close in an official letter:
questions.explanation: Formal general address uses 'Faithfully', specific name uses 'Sincerely', informal uses 'Best wishes'.
questions.hint: Faithfully serves the position, Sincerely serves the person.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a 'Negative Incidence Report'?

options.text: To inform the employer of an unusual event for legal reasons

questions.explanation: Negative incidence reports document accidents or unusual events to protect the institution and staff in case of legal action.

questions.question: Which of the following are principles of writing a good report? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Include personal opinions in factual sections
Start with the most pressing problem

questions.explanation: Reports should be factual, concise, logical, and prioritize urgent issues. Personal opinions should be omitted from factual sections.

questions.question: In an official letter, 'FAO' stands for For the ___BLANK___ Of.
questions.explanation: FAO stands for For the Attention Of, indicating the specific person who should handle the letter.

questions.question: When writing a Negative Incident Statement, you should:

options.text: State only the truth of exactly what you saw

questions.explanation: Incident reports must be immediate, factual, non-emotional, and include witness names.
questions.hint: Be a camera, not a commentator.

questions.question: What is the name of the report written annually to summarize an employee's performance and abilities?
questions.explanation: An Appraisal Report evaluates an employee's performance over a specific period, usually a year.

questions.question: A Health Centre Report should include the total number of staff, new cases seen, and problems experienced.
questions.explanation: Health centre reports cover staff statistics, patient cases/morbidity, and administrative problems.
questions.hint: It covers everything happening in the facility.

questions.question: Arrange the structure of an official letter from top to bottom:

richContent.content: Letter Structure Task

questions.explanation: Standard official letter format: Sender -> Receiver -> Salutation -> Subject -> Body -> Close.
questions.hint: Who sends it, who gets it, what is it about.

questions.question: Which principle of letter writing refers to using polite phrases and showing consideration for the correspondent?
questions.explanation: Courtesy involves politeness and respect. Clarity is about understanding; Conciseness is about brevity.

questions.question: Which of the following incidents require a Negative Incidence Report? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Suicide, absconding, and errors are negative incidents. Scheduled leave is normal administration.
